definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: Tens of thousands of flag-waving activists called for early elections.
sentences.chinese: 数以万计挥舞着国旗的积极分子要求提早进行选举。

sentences.english: There are tens of thousands of Hong Ke, or red visitors, as they are known in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，这些数以万计黑客们被称为“红客”。

sentences.english: Livestock in the tens of thousands has been lost.
sentences.chinese: 数以万计的牲畜顷刻间消失。

sentences.english: That's because tens of thousands of honey bees have invaded downtown Pittsfield.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为数以万计的蜜蜂入侵了皮茨菲尔德市区。

sentences.english: We've had tens of thousands that will call us a wonder of the world.
sentences.chinese: 数以万计的人都称这里是世界奇观。

sentences.english: They sold in the thousands, and in the tens of thousands.
sentences.chinese: 它们的销售成绩数以千计，数以万计。

sentences.english: Around the globe, we estimate that there are billions of news pages containing every story ever written.
sentences.chinese: 我们在全球发现了数以万计的曾经写过的新闻页面。

sentences.english: The country's drama academies are "holy lands" to tens of thousands of showbiz hopefuls like Wang.
sentences.chinese: 国家戏剧学院是像王一样数以万计后选人的圣堂。

sentences.english: Millions of people need its sanctuary and protection.
sentences.chinese: 数以万计的人们需要他的庇护。

sentences.english: The global financial melt-down is creating hardship for many people.
sentences.chinese: 全球金融危机使数以万计人处于苦难中。

sentences.english: Special operations forces have added tens of thousands to their ranks.
sentences.chinese: 数以万计的特种部队被派往前线。

sentences.english: He has taught millions upon millions of young men.
sentences.chinese: 他教过数以万计的青年男子。

sentences.english: However, the land of ten thousand lakes is written on Minnesota's vehicle license plates.
sentences.chinese: 但是，明尼苏达州的交通图上标有它数以万计的湖泊。

sentences.english: It has improved the medical and surgical management of countless patients.
sentences.chinese: 它改善了数以万计患者的内外科治疗。

sentences.english: All of these businesses combined, he said, employ tens of thousands of workers.
sentences.chinese: 他说，所有这些企业加在一起雇用了数以万计的工人。

sentences.english: Thousands cheered and waved as the pontiff entered in his popemobile.
sentences.chinese: 当教皇坐驾抵临时，数以万计的人振臂欢呼。

definition: lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
over ten thousand/fig. untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
